author: Staff Reporter
text:
A construction worker was killed and another injured when a portion of a new building where they were at work collapsed on them on Wednesday.

According to the Sirumugai police, the workers, D. Nagaraj (35) and M. Somasundaram (37), were standing on a wooden ladder at a height of about 10 feet and working when the incident took place in the afternoon.

Nagaraj died on way to the hospital and Somasundaram was hospitalised. A case was registered against the building engineer and contractor under Sections 288 (negligent conduct with respect to pulling down or repairing buildings), 337 (causing hurt by act endangering life or personal safety of others) and 304(A) (causing death by negligence) of the Indian Penal Code for failing to ensure safety of the workers.

Detained under

Goondas Act

City Police Commissioner A. Amalraj has ordered the detention of S. Chandrabose (24) and R. Sivakumar (33) under Goondas Act at Coimbatore Central Prison, with effect from February 27. The duo was detained under the Act as they had been found involved in a series of chain snatching incidents.

The recent case against them was the chain snatching bid that claimed the life of R. Meenakshi (38), on Thondamuthur Road when she was returning home with her son Rahul (15).

Theft at financing firm

A finance firm located on the first floor of a commercial complex at Uppilipalayam near Singanallur was burgled on Wednesday. The police said that the accused broke open the front door of the firm and took away Rs. 1 lakh in cash and a laptop.
title: Man killed as building collapses
